Reviews.Title: “Location Good! Cleanliness TERRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1Suntanner
Reviews.Content: Very dirty place!! Carpet disgusting! Air conditioner unit didnt look like its been cleaned in quite sometime! So if we get respiratory infections we no the source! Beds were very uncomfortable. Bed clothing old & torn. Nice to have a sliding class door- but- if uou can't see out of it- what's the purpose of paying for it?? Not cleaned on daily cleaning @ all. The only thing that was done daily was the bed thrown back together! Disgustingly dirty coffe pot (white) with mold in it- they exchanged it for one that was black in color so you couldnt see the mold! Very dirty glass carafe with it! Would never use it!! They charge top dollar for the location! Owner needs to access rooms & staff! Bathroom air vents never cleaned! Won't waste my money next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kmariam
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Aug. 7-10. We were on the fourth floor in a side-view jacuzzi room, and our view of the ocean was still pretty awesome. We didn't make much use of the cupboards in the room, but it was nice to have the sink, counter and fridge. The maid service was great, very friendly, and the front desk was friendly as well. Parking deck was nice to have. No bugs in our room! It was clean and everything we were looking for in a beach front hotel. (If you want fancy things and super soft sheets, go pay the premiums of hilton, etc!) We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY - VERY CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: Terri Ann M
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean spacious room. - enjoyed our stay very much..Quiet. The staff was very nice and were eager to help. We felt very safe and secure. Did find the rooms to be damp but being beachfront that's expected. We asked what internet and were provided a password to log in ..could not connect..very weak signal.. You wont be disappointed with this property :):)

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Diane B
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean room with a great view. Very accommodating! I needed a ground floor room because of a breathing problem. Loved the parking garage. Nice to get into a cooler car. Room was a little damp despite the air conditioning working very well. Maybe cause we were so close to the ocean. Overall nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for a Last Minute Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Erlyrizrjr
Reviews.Content: In the past year, this is my family's 3rd trip to Ocean city. The 1st time was Days Inn Oceanfront @ 23rd, a few days before Hurricane Irene hit, had to evacuate, thank God, the place sucked! (I wrote a review on it last year). 2nd was week before Memorial day 2012,stayed at the Quality inn Boardwalk @ 17th st. Very nice place and would stay there again but was sold out on our 3rd visit on 8/7/12. The Crystal Beach had vacancies, so we stayed here. Location & parking garage was a plus! The Hotel & Rooms were very clean. The room itself had an kitchenette but no stove, only microwave, ok, planned on eating out anyway. The room was big, 2 queen beds, pullout sofa, 2 chairs & table. Could use another piece of furniture in room, looked a little empty. Very clean, nice balcony, and the whole Hotel smelled clean. Now the bad points, the pool was small and the lounge area around pool was small. Booked a room that was ocean view. It was the side of the hotel and had a partial view of the ocean, not a big deal, but if I knew the poolview room was the oceanfront room also , I would have taken this room for 40.00 cheaper! Now if the people who worked here were a little nicer, I would have found this out. So I give this Hotel for rooms & cleanliness an 8 out of 10. For the employees a score of 5 out of 10. If I had to stay here again, I would but I'm sure there are many other nice places I need to check out 1st!

Reviews.Title: “Facility”
Reviews.Author: Janel C
Reviews.Content: I'm from NY and I went to Crtsal Beach for the weekend, the rooms weren't even average, I've seen hotels in the area that looks better and their rooms. The mattress were hard and uncomfortable, the sofa in the room was unkept and had ciggarette burns in them, and the cieling had spots of mold. I'm not quite sure how all the rooms were but this facility isn't worth the price I think your only paying for accessablity to the beach since it's foot steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: hagerterp
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying it was clean. Hotel was in a good location. There is nothing fancy about this hotel. Rooms need updating. Especially the bedding. The mattress on the pull out couch had the inside falling out.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, could be better.”
Reviews.Author: Vanna888
Reviews.Content: The positive: location is GREAT, love the "quiet" end of the boardwalk away from the hustle and bustle and carnival-like atmosphere at the other end. Can't beat the unobstructed view of the beautiful beach. Close to the tram station. Within walking distance of several restaurants, miniature golf, and stores. Less expensive than other boardwalk hotels. Rooms were spacious and comfortable with all the promised amenities. Friendly and helpful front desk staff. Clean. The housekeeping staff were always around. Paking not an issue. The negative: the old bedspreads, hotel blankets, and curtains have got to go. Each of these (yes, both beds) was stained and/or torn. Gross. The sheets are probably supposed to be a cream color but this makes them look dingy and unclean also. The pillows are really thin. They don't put a fitted sheet on the mattress (only a flat one), so when you sleep you wake up with your body against the bare mattress. Speaking of the mattresses, they've got to go also. Very old and no longer firm or comfortable. The grout in the bathroom is stained/chipped. The TV was busted/cracked in the corner. There was a light out in the entryway of room. Our fridge was not working properly. After notifying the front desk, someone came up with a new fridge in less than 10 minutes (this was good). Our toilet became partially clogged without reason but then resoved itself the next day. The air-conditioning was bearly adequate. To be fair, we didn't complain about this because we didn't want to be moved to a different room. There were three couples in our group each staying in three different rooms on three different floors. Between all of us there were two broken phones, a broken TV, a broken fridge, and two clogged toilets. The staff did promptly correct anything that was brought to their attention. Overall: Despite the negatives, staying here was still not a bad experience. I view these things minor annoyances versus major issues. If you want to stay in a clean, affordable place with a great boardwalk location, consider staying here. If you expect perfection and are easily upset when things are not exactly right, this is not the place for you. I would certainly consider staying here again but would also look into similar places that are better maintained. Upgrades to the bedding, appliances, and heating/plumbing systems would bring me back sooner.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate and affordable”
Reviews.Author: familyofsixgreens
Reviews.Content: Our oceanview efficiency was somewhat outdated but clean . Front desk quickly responded to several issues we had in room . ( Fridge not staying shut, TV remote not working, tree limbs grown up obstructing view from balcony. ) Housekeeping was thorough and efficient. Nice location on quiet end of boardwalk with easy access to the fun stuff. The mattressess were quite old and worn , only covered with flat sheets that rolled up at night leaving us on questionable old mattress top. I had the worst backache ever every morning after waking up from that mattress, and I'm not usually one to complain of backaches!! Security doors at halway ends were broken/ not locked ever. Tiny pool directly on boardwalk, only steps from hose for people to wash sand off from the beach. The hotel was adequate for the price, would probably spend a few bucks extra for a little better quality next time though!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service excellence hotel clean safe great for children nice on the boardwalk far away from all of the commotion I have”
Reviews.Author: Zelfa
Reviews.Content: Excellent room excellence hotel clean rooms service is excellent Great for children on quiet part of boardwalk friendly staff will return next year. Have gone 4 years in a row. Pool is great for children very close to the beach on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Our place at the beach”
Reviews.Author: Ella G
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 3rd floor Oceanfront. The cleaning staff was excellent. They were very friendly and always had our room cleaned when we came back to it. The office staff was also very friendly. This was not our first stay at the Crystal Beach. This was our 4th year at the hotel. We love the location and have stayed in nearby hotels in the past but they did not compare to the excellent service we received here. We will definitely be back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “decent stay”
Reviews.Author: eileen g
Reviews.Content: Great location! On boardwalk, across from beach. room was spacious because of the pull out couch (traveling with 3 kids) not too fond of the pool because since its on boardwalk, next to the beach, people coming from the beach like to rinse the sand off their bodies into the pool. Which was very gross!! About the beds, u can feel the springs in the mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Sue H
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Crystal Beach with the room and conveinence to shops and dining. Especially, in walking distance to the beach and the friendly staff. Sue H. from Pennsylvania

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: family f
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay. right on the beach. The maid on the 3rd floor was wonderful.... she did a great job on cleaning our room. She should get a raise... Front desk was very friendly and they even checked us in earlier than there 3p check in time. We plan on stayin there again next year....

Reviews.Title: “terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: Dayna L
Reviews.Content: It would be nicer, BUT they need to update the beds and the blankets on the beds..looks like the very first blankets ever made. It just makes the rooms look VERY bad with their old blankets..especially for over 200 a night..

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: mikenas007
Reviews.Content: Needs updated TVs are ancient and the remotes don't work the beds need changed the springs are starting to come through front desk is friendly the rooms all smell of smoke I actually went to Walmart and bought some fabreeze and candles it's an okay place to stay if there's nothing left but there standards have gone down tremendously

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: jay383
Reviews.Content: Very nice ..great location for car cruise weekend..

Reviews.Title: “Dirty!”
Reviews.Author: maddawg57
Reviews.Content: Place was dirty and housekeeping did not clean our room.

Reviews.Title: “great location, on the boards.”
Reviews.Author: StrwbryShrtK
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel but a bit more pricer then our usual motel we stay at. If you have more then 4 people you'll feel squished the rooms could be a little more bigger. I didn't like how the pool was in front of the hotel on the boardwalk so everyone can see you while you swim and lay out on the chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Themorsefamily
Reviews.Content: After reading other posts I was nervous about our stay. To set the record straight, there were no bed bugs!!!! We had ocean view room and it was lovely. Never heard a sound from boardwalk traffic. No big deal to get ice from first floor, as hotel isn't overly large. Staff was definately foreign, as was most all the employees at any of the stores. I was glad to be a bit away from the crowds, and still be part of the boardwalk. I really enjoyed my stay. Only complaint was the daily maid service. They didn't do much but make beds and give I new towels. Rarely vacuumed, and didn't wipe counters.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Strahberrie
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about our stay, we had a first floor pool view room (which was ocean view too) Room was very clean and quiet. Check-in was a breeze, plenty of parking, no issues at all. My son accidently left his favorite blanket in the room after we checked out, one call to the front desk and they were able to find it and we were told they will mail it for us. Great stay overall, would book again! Thank you :)

Reviews.Title: “Tried it for the first time - might come again, but not first choice.”
Reviews.Author: WalksSoftly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Crystal Beach Hotel on the last weekend of April (2012) because our usual Boardwalk hotel was booked due to several events in town. The best thing about the Crystal Beach Hotel is the location. You can't beat the quiet north end of the Boardwalk. We were initially pleased with the room. The view was great and it wasn't anything more than we needed for the weekend, but things weren't quite as nice as we're used to - even at the beach. While we had no complaints about the cleanliness or service, the beds were rock hard and there were no extra pillows (in fairness, we didn't ask for any), but pillows wouldn't have helped the problem of feeling the mattress springs poking at you all night long. The exhaust fan in the bathroom (on the same switch as the main light) also sounded like its bearings were about to give out completely and the screeching noise would last for several minutes after being turned on or off - so after the second or third time, we just left it on all weekend. Turns out the exhaust fan wasn't a problem though, since there was no hot water on Sunday morning. I let it run for a good 15 minutes (figuring it may just take a while to get up to the top floor in an empty hotel), before I gave up and took a cold shower. It never did get hot and the front desk advised me that the maintenance guy didn't get in until 8:00. I wouldn't rule out the Crystal Beach Hotel in the future, but it certainly wouldn't be my first choice. Still - it's certainly average for beach hotels in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “ACCEPTABLE”
Reviews.Author: Hawkrridge
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dated but clean , quiet, and comfortable. Their beds were exceptionally firm and comfortable. The oceanfront balcony was spacious...but nothing to look at since the hotel is located at the end of the boardwallk. Very quiet . Amenities are minimal...no tissue paper, ice and vending machines are only available at the lobby level. Parking is available at another bldg next to the hotel...a little inconvenient but not bad! If quiet is what u want, this is the hotel for u. Stayed for 3 nites!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the naysayers”
Reviews.Author: caseyreno
Reviews.Content: Booked a Jacuzzi sideview room just to get away with my boyfriend. Room. Overlooked the ocean and we were down here during a Mideastern. Only had one issue with a demagnitized keycard which the staff was happy to redo. We were two of possibly ten people. Very quiet, housekeeping was prompt and efficient. Looking forward to staying here again and we have three more Days here!"!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Snazzyt01
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is described as newer, it seems like something from the 80’s. The bedding, flooring, wallpaper, fixtures, and furniture are dated. The uncomfortable mattresses sag along the edges from wear. The room was fairly clean, but the tile/grout in the foyer and bathroom could be cleaner. The room was musty smelling, so bring some Lysol. The refrigerator and counter were dirty, as was the furniture on the balcony. There are minimal amenities, you can’t even get a box of tissues, bring your own extra pillows, etc. The staff was friendly. The location is great, right on the quiet end of the boardwalk. Parking was convenient. Try not to over pay for your 2-star stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very NIce & Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: Shirl S
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed August 4 - 8, 2011, for the first time. Staff and housekeeping were very friendly and helpful. Garage & elevator very convenient. Room is a nice size and kitchenette came in handy. The hotel and room was very clean and smells fresh throughout. The hotel's location is great for boardwalk, and other attractions, restaurants and shops nearby. The pool and patio was also very nice. We loved staying at Crystal Beach. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “I honestly loved our trip here...”
Reviews.Author: allisonunger
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 5 night stay with my mom and son. For an ocean city hotel trust me this one was not bad at all!!! The front desk people were nothing but nice to us and helpful when asking about places to eat. The rooms were spacious while not luxurious they were clean...our housekeeper Jolin or yolin did an extremely good job of taking care of the room. It was a good location as well...a block away from the bus stop and you could catch the tram right outside on the boardwalk....beware tram is soooo slow and will stop every 15 feet to let people off and on. I don't know what people expect for a beach hotel if you want lap of luxury go stay at the ritz carlton. I would come back again and recommend!

Reviews.Title: “OMG blood all over the mattress”
Reviews.Author: MarieJ48
Reviews.Content: Strange since this is a relateivly newer property on the beach. I think they got the mattresses used from another hotel. A large portion of the box spring side was covered with what looked like blood. I pointed it out to my husband and he said, dont worry about itt. After I thought about it later, I cursed myself for tolerating sleeping on it. Around $250 per nite. Slumlord.

Reviews.Title: “We stay here every year!”
Reviews.Author: YearlyVisitors
Reviews.Content: My husband and I happened upon Crystal Beach Hotel five summers ago. We absolutely love it. Love the quiet end of the boardwalk, enjoy the swimming pool, have gotten to know our wonderful maid, Cheryl, who even babysat for us this summer so we could go out alone. No, it's not fancy. Yes, bring your own utensils and such. But for boardwalk, a parking space, a pool, it can't be beat. Two summers we've needed to leave a day early and, having gotten to know the owners, they've graciously refunded our last night without us even asking. We will continue to stay at and recommend Crystal Beach Hotel. Thanks, guys! Husband and I coming back alone in a few weeks!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and good location”
Reviews.Author: dontcallmecas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years ago with a friend. The room was very clean and it had a jacuzzi which was a plus. It is on the quiet, more relaxing end of the boardwalk but it is still close to everything. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone who would like to stay on the beach but does not want to be in a noisy area.

Reviews.Title: “Not for guests under 25"”
Reviews.Author: DECrabLover
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice hotel, however, only a week before I was to stay they notified me by email that they have a policy where guests under 25 who are not accompanied by parent or legal guardian must pay a $100 cash security deposit EACH on top of the initial deposit. I was very disappointed by such a deposit that is not required by any other hotel. This policy was not listed on the site. Our room was clean and comfortable but having to put down $200 cash certainly put a damper on our stay and the staff was rather rude. I have since booked with other hotels and have not had to pay this fee. If you are over 25, this is a great place to stay; under 25- There are other comparable hotels that are more receptive and respectful.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be fooled by the pictures.”
Reviews.Author: chicamalia
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for Friday and Saturday night, due to check out Sunday morning. I was with my husband and our 3 year old son. When you check out the hotels website they say the place was built in 2002 but the rooms had more of a feel of the early 80's. The second night we were there the sliding glass door completely came off the hidges (remember traveling with a 3 year old boy) and when my husband went to the front desk to report the problem the man behind the counter informed him that the maintenance guy was out for the day. The hotel was completely booked so they couldn't move us to another room. Needless to say I had a hard time sleeping due to the fact that I thought my son would wander out of our first floor room and climb the rails and end up on the boardwalk or who knows where. When my husband called to inquire about some sort of partial refund the manager told him there was nothing he could do than offer us a discount on a future trip. My husband informed the manager that wasn't going to happen and we would never come back. I have stayed at other hotels in Ocean City and I very much regret trying something new. Next time we are going to stay at the Sea Hawk!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: dadmomand2
Reviews.Content: Our stay was part of a golf package. It was a great deal. Two nights and three rounds of golf on good courses for two, for under $450.00. The hotel was clean but in need of work. It was the end of the season. If you expect a lot of service at a hotel, this hotel may not be for you, but if you don't mind going out for meals and walking to the first floor for ice, this place may be for you. We booked the trip through Pams Ocean City MD Golf and they really worked with us on getting the best courses available.

Reviews.Title: “save your money go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: ja3793
Reviews.Content: booked rooms for July 4 week had to take smoking room WOW really bad we used 2 cans of Lysol did nothing my fault noise at night from boardwalk sucked When i was checking in the girl behind the desk didn't say one word not a hello a thank you nothing seems she didn't speak English or who knows the room was dirty the halls dirty the parking garage dirty the outdoor pool was really dirty didnt go in at all we watched as a kid threw up in pool and parent scooped out with bucket . the doors are open to the side where anyone from boardwalk can access any floor. I wouldn't stay here again ever mostly because of the reception of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate basic beach motel with uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Framework
Reviews.Content: Hotel has good location -- on the beach, on the quiet end of the boardwalk, walking distance to Jolly Roger amusement park, restaurants, etc. Room was fairly clean and functional, with microwave, fridge and kitchen sink. Queen beds were extremely uncomfortable; pull-out sofa was gross and a bad joke to sleep on. Not the best choice in town, but also not the worst.

Reviews.Title: “The beds were the worst we've ever slept on.”
Reviews.Author: yogibear1962
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed with the mattresses in this hotel. The 2 queen beds were bad enough, but the pull out couch was terrible. The couch itself was not comfortable because there was no support. The mattress was so thin and caved in that we complained.. to no avail. Small kids would be uncomfortable, let alone teenagers or adults. The rooms were fairly clean, though the popcorn ceiling was peeling at spots and there were areas that had spots which were either stains or mold coming through. The pool is small and does get shaded early. Overall it is not a bad place if you don't mind very cheap uncomfortable mattresses. We will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: xohotmamma
Reviews.Content: After researching economical, yet clean hotels with an ocean view, my family decided to give Crystal Beach Hotel a try. We had 2 young children and one teenager who truly enjoyed their experience at the Crystal Beach Hotel. The staff was very friendly and courteous. Being a customer service manager, I expect nothing but the best and Crystal Beach met all of my expectations. From the front desk to the maid service everyone was very nice and accommodating. They truly were there to service you and your needs. Our maid Amanda was so very nice that our children wanted to take her home...LOL! In addition, the facility was clean & comfortable, even the pool was crystal clear (no pun intended). Every morning the staff cleaned the pool and the condition of the pool justified this. As indicated we had an ocean view and it couldn't have been more enjoyable. In addition to the staff, we found all other guests to be very friendly and welcoming. Sitting poolside we met many families from different areas who made you feel like you were hanging out with close friends, not strangers. Overall, our experience was truly an enjoyable one and we will definitely stay here again upon our next visit to Ocean City!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great View, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: arno92781
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 3 year old and I stayed at this hotel last June. I booked this hotel because the rates were cheap for an ocean front room in early June right on the boardwalk. The room was nice and we loved the spacious balcony and the VIEW! I also loved the location, right on the boardwalk...but never too noisey! The only thing we wish the hotel would have had was either a heated pool or an indoor pool. The pool was freezing...but I do know it was only June. We also liked a little mom and pop restaurant right behind the hotel called Happy Jacks Pancake House (try it out). With that said, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and we are going again this June..can't wait!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here every year”
Reviews.Author: Joshdta
Reviews.Content: We go to OC at least once a year. I have stayed at this hotel for the last 5 yrs. It is a great place to relax as it is on the quit end of the boardwalk. It is very nice and clean. The staff has always been welcoming and the rates are good. It has a on sight parking garage that keeps the sea salt off you car. ( not good if you have a large truck ). Ocean front rooms are right on the boardwalk over looking the small pool. Side view rooms you can see the ocean, boardwalk, and the bay. Plus they sleep up to 6 people. Located on 25 st. It is right beside Happy Jacks's for breakfast, and the fractured prune donut shop, and embers all you can eat buffet is just two blocks away. There is also a sunsations shop right across the street for getting beach stuff. Jolly Rodgers water park is just 5 blocks away. Has easy access to the 27th street boardwalk trolley station. I have always made my reservations via the web and have never had any trouble with the booking or the card being over charged. Even went in march for my birthday, they are open year round.

Reviews.Title: “St. Patrick's Day”
Reviews.Author: jack21903
Reviews.Content: A large group of our friends and us stayed at this hotel for the St. Patrick's Day Parade and festivities. The hotel was clean, rooms stocked, and staff friendly. There is a covered parking garage right next to the hotel which is nice for keeping your car out of the weather and keeping you dry on rainy/snowy days. The room was nice, we had a jacuzzi room. We've stayed in better, but it was decent price and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Great Price”
Reviews.Author: mommaof2canonsburg
Reviews.Content: We stayed the previous year and came back again this year. The service was great and accomodating. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a basic hotel with no frills. We had a side view room on the 4th floor that you can still see both the bay and the ocean from this point. The hotel room offers a little kitchenette with microwave, toaster, coffee maker and fridge. We brought along our indoor grill and that worked beautifully for breakfast and lunch, so that we could go out and have a nice dinner. I can't wait until next year to return.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: viperv10
Reviews.Content: Was lied to, the room smelled like crap couldnt breath had to be move at 3 am, only to find my new room had ants couldnt freaken believe this place, the only good thing about this place is the parking. Very dissapointed

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and with a great view of the ocean”
Reviews.Author: Mieob9arg
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Crystal Beach Hotel and we were pleasantly surprised. The first impression as we got off the elevator to our room was the smell of clean linens. The room was clean and staff was friendly. We stayed during Bike Week and could not hear the bikes going up and down. They have a parking garage but if staying on the fifth floor you have to take a maze of steps or the elevator down to the third floor to enter it. Room had a microwave and small fridge. Styrofoam cups and coffee supplies were provided.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD WITH THE POTENTIAL TO BE GREAT”
Reviews.Author: LadyCNewYork
Reviews.Content: Got a last minute reservation via internet.for a double queen bed efficiency. Upon arrival I was given a double bed efficiency with handicapped railings and shower. No problem except specially designed shower kept the bathroom floor dangerously wet and extended over into the kitchen area. The 2 areas remained wet for the entire stay. The tv and the remote were incompatible and therefore did not work. The efficiency was very large and contained nice, clean working appliances. Room was poolside and had a nice-non private patio. Overall the room was good, with a little better maintenance rooms it could have been great.

Reviews.Title: “Crusty Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BelieveInYourself
Reviews.Content: Room #202. Check in/out was fast. Let us in two hours early. Room was a good size and quiet. The elevator was just outside our room as were the steps through an unsecured door that leads to the sidewalk. It was easy to park because the parking garage was never full. The queen beds were uncomfortable. The pull out sofa bed had a worn out mattress. The sofa bed sheets were dirty and the replacement sheets we requested were stained. The air conditioner was difficult to obtain a consistent, comfortable temperature. Wallpaper was peeling off the walls. The screen to the patio slider was out of the track and flapping in the wind. The shower curtain was moldy. The pool was small and uninviting. We paid $250 a night which is about average for a room on the boardwalk in July. We would not stay here again. Do yourself a favor and stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: CPRNEastNorthport
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my husband, daughter in law,and two grandsons, ages 6 and 8. After reading some of the previous reviews I wasn't sure what we would find. I was surprised to find the hotel located in a great location, the hotel staff was friendly and the room was clean. Pool was in good shape. Building shades pool after 2. So plan accordingly. Room was cleaned daily with linens changed. I was surprised to find no utensils and plates in the room as it is listed as an efficency kitchen. Luckily ,we did bring our own paper plates, cups and plastic flatware. We forgot to bring cooking spoons and knives but went to a local ACE store and purchased utensils. Beds were ok - no pillowtops as I am used to at home. There is a hotel parking garage that is free of charge. But for the price I can't complain. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “tough at first”
Reviews.Author: freeflight61
Reviews.Content: Was not impressed by the room that we had, first, bathroom was dirty, black mold on the sealing, and shower curtains, television controls were not working , the travel book said that this was a newer hotel, but new when?? after complaining about room ,, we were not given another , bring your own extra blankets and pillows here, because you wont get them from the staff , i found that having to leave a tip envolope in the room for the maids was asking a little to much for a job not done well. I find that we paid way to much for our week here, and for an extra 50 dollars a night we could have stayed somewhere else that was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Impecable Stay, the Best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: iloveocmd_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crystal Beach Hotel for 4 nights in the begining of July and in was wonderful. Our room was spacious and had an incredible view. The staff was very friendly and accommodating as well. It was very nice and clean. I would suggest this hotel to anyone and will definatly be returning

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive and dishonest...disappointing stay at the Crystal Beach”
Reviews.Author: ravenmaniac2632
Reviews.Content: We finally decided on the Crystal Beach after driving ourselves crazy researching, and calling around looking for a "reasonable" beach front unit on the boardwalk. The person who took my reservation over the phone told me I would have an efficiency overlooking the ocean. I would consider an efficiency to have some type of appliance to cook on. Well, I suppose they count a toaster as a "full kitchen", because there was no stove, and all of the items we brought to make in the efficiency went back in the bags. I thought trying to make spaghetti with the toaster would have been a little difficult. To be honest I did not inquire about Wifi when I talked to a somewhat disinterested Crystal Beach person on the phone, but I was really ticked when I found out we had to pay for access. In my experience, having to pay for internet access was unheard of. Not only did I have to pay the service, it was incredibly bad. When the Wifi worked it was very slow and kicked you off every five minutes. I complained to the management only to discover they contract a third party Wifi provider, and my $13.95 plus tax would have to be refunded through them. Considering I was charged some kind of $3.00 fee for Wifi upfront I find their method of operation disturbing. Cleanliness; I know its Ocean City, but it could have been better. The reason I say this is when we had cause to refit the ill fitted sheets on one of the beds there were toenail clippings and general crud under the bed...yuck. Comfort; the room never dried out. even though the air conditioner worked, it did not remove the moisture from the air. Everything was damp at all times, and after three we felt like mushrooms. Staff; I know others have remarked regarding the staff's helpfulness and friendliness. I can neither confirm or deny as we had minimal contact with them. But, the phone conversation was pretty much consisted of word answers, and a curt demeanor. Overall I would recommend staying elsewhere based on their lack of honesty regarding the type of unit I thought I had purchased.

Reviews.Title: “Mildew,mold and bugs...oh my!!”
Reviews.Author: truthbtold4realz
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY THERE! The room I stayed at had mold on the ceiling and when I moved to another room...same problem! Luckily, my friends and I had our own sheets, but sill couldn't sleep from the foul smell that came from the mattress. We woke up 6am and got ready to leave. We did not want to stay there another minute. Also, the coffee machine had white stuff inside,so we didn't even want to use it. Gross! I told the front desk person to report the mold because 2 rooms had it. I'm sure more rooms have mold. As soon as we left, we went to wash all our sheets. We ended up staying at the Days Inn and were just thankful the room had no mold and smell from the mattress. I'm not going to just write this comment on this site...I'm going to report Crystal Beach Hotel and make sure they get this problem resolved!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting and awful...”
Reviews.Author: an0nym0us123
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Crystal Beach for a weekend trip. The pictures on the website and the exterior looked nice, so we decided to stay here. We were told we can check in at 3pm. We tried to check in at 3:30pm, but when we went to our room they were still cleaning it. We went back down to the front desk and they gave us another room. Later, we noticed black stains on the ceiling- MOLD! We called front desk and they gave us another room. We changed rooms- thinking it was a little better. The new room also had mold in fewer spots- it was late so we decided to stay the night and check into another hotel the next day. During the night, I smelled something nasty, but couldn't figure out where it was coming from so we opened the sliding glass door. In the morning I realized the smell was from my mattress! It was so disgusting!!!! It smelled like "old, wet laundry" and "sweaty, gym socks!" We told the girl working at the front desk about the moldy ceiling and the stinky mattress and she said it was probably because we slept with the sliding glass door open. Umm...right. I don't think one night of sleeping with the door open would cause moldy ceilings or stinky mattresses. This was just an awful place to stay. NOT WORTH THE $220 a night. We weren't expecting anything extraordinary, but something decent. Crystal Beach needs help!

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: 4mykidsalways
Reviews.Content: My husband and i just returned from Ocen City after a great weekend. We stayed at the Crystal Beach on 25th St. It was a very nice place and located at the end of the boardwalk .We were very happy with our stay. The girls were great at the desk. We even got an early checkin and when we checked out they allowed us to leave our car in the parking lot for a few hours. We will definitly return.

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVEABLE STAY AND GREAT MANAGEMENT”
Reviews.Author: ILOVEOCMD
Reviews.Content: This was my 7th time going to ocean city with my friends. we have stayed at the crystal beach for the past few years and it has been a great experience. the hotel is extremely clean and the location is outstanding. there is nothing bad to say about it. IF YOU WANT AN ENJOYABLE EXPERIENCE STAY HERE. this is the best hotel in OC!

Reviews.Title: “Great accommations and great staff”
Reviews.Author: cindynascar24
Reviews.Content: This trip was for the Council of Ravens Roosts Convention. Ravens Roost #75 has stayed here for several years and we are treated wonderfully. Great prices as well. Nice rooms with 2 beds and small kitchenette. Pool and located on the boardwalk. Many eateries within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: choria9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the first time at Crystal Beach and were very pleased. We had an oceanfront room with a great view of the ocean and boardwalk. Very clean. After reading some of the reviews we were a bit leery but were pleasantly surprised. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: theatremom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crystal Beach at the last minute for a quick weekend trip when our other top choices were fully booked. The price was good ($99), but the room was very basic. Two queen beds, TV, small dresser, microwave, dirty coffee maker, refrigerator, small sink, toaster. Only bathroom amenities were towels, an old hairdryer, a few bars of soap, and small bottle of shampoo. I had to phone the front desk for a box of kleenex and a wash cloth. No clock radio or alarm clock (no clock whatsoever in the room). When we walked in the room, the sliding door to the oceanfront balcony was wide open and the room was freezing. It was a beautiful weekend, but I guess the door had been left open all night when the temperature dropped low the night before. The toilet was very dirty as was the whole bathroom floor. When I phoned the desk the receptionist said the room had not been used all winter, so the door had been opened to " air out the room." The beds were clean and comfortable, but the carpeting was old and worn. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Vacati0n_ah0lic
Reviews.Content: I was initially very pleased with the Crystal Beach Hotel in Ocean City. It was exactly what I had expected after reading everyone's reviews. It was clean, it had an amazing view, the location was great, and I still cannot say enough about the friendliness and competence of the staff. Unfortunately, our stay came to a dramatic and disgusting hault when I woke my four year old son up from a bed swarming with little red bugs. Bed Bugs. YUCK! In fairness to the hotel and its staff, this situation was handled well. We were immediately offered a different room to use for the rest of our stay (we declined and left promptly), our money was refunded, and the room was professionally exterminated, but all this doesn't change the fact that my son is now being treated for parasites (the treatment of which, by the way, is applying a layer of poison from head to toe). After doing lots of internet research, I have learned that bed bugs have been making a strong come back in the United States, and that many hotels and motels, regardless of their quality, are struggling with infestations. It does not change the fact that I will never return to this establishment, and I am hopeful that none of you relive our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Cyrstal Beach”
Reviews.Author: jodim
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in August 2008. The room was an ocean view on the top floor. It had 2 queen beds. The room was clean and the hotel was great. The view was beautiful. We were near the elevator but never noticed noise. The pool is small but the kids enjoyed it. Most of the pool was in the shade by 3pm so it got a little chilly. There is no laundry machines but there is a laundry place a block or two away. There are so many great places to eat within walking distance. I would definitely consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Good time!”
Reviews.Author: debbi610
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay. 3 adults, 2 children were fine in room with 2 double beds and sofa pull out. Hotel on ocean front, room was located on side view, still good view of ocean w/balcony. A/C could be upgraded, freezes one side of room, other side where the table and chairs are, is quite warm......weird. But overall we enjoyed ourselfs and will probably return in the future. Also a plus is the parking garage! Photos are clearly as you see on website.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as Before”
Reviews.Author: Denise046
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two years ago and was very pleased with the entire hotel. This time was just as nice as before. The hotel staff is very friendly and accomodating. The rooms are pleasant and clean. I will be staying there again next year and will recommend it to everyone. Thanks for a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: LTHOUSEAmerica
Reviews.Content: Ocean City, MD - Crystal Beach Hotel - "Really nice!". Date: July 27, 2008 Reviewer: TripAdvisor member, Lower Burrell, PA Stayed on the 4th floor (non-smoking floor), ocean front w/balcony. Had two queen-size beds, nice size bathroom w/tub & shower and hair dryer, kitchenette (microwave, small fridge, bar sink, cabinet space, & coffee pot w/coffee and tea daily), ironing board w/iron. The room was carpeted and tiled in kitchen and bathroom. The balcony had two chairs, with room for more. The front desk staff and housekeeping were courteous and helpful. Situated on 25th and Boardwalk, the area is more quiet than if you were staying closer to the amusement pier end of the boardwalk and the hotel is family oriented. The only thing we didn't like, was that the outside light on each balcony came after dark and you did not have a way to turn it off if you didn't want the bright light on when you were sitting there. Overall, it is a very nice hotel and I would reccomend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK”
Reviews.Author: HOvalle26
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about this hotel but I did read many good reviews so I decided to book. Check in was no problem, we got to our room (pool side) and smelled a horrible smell and the carpet was wet. We got everything packed in went out to dinner and came back but the smell was still there. We went to the front desked and she came in to smell and offered us air freshner, we said that was not an option and she said everything was booked and after threating to leave, she said there are 2 ocean front rooms open but we have to wait until 8pm just in case walk in's come. We did get it on the 4th floor w/ no extra charge. The hotel we eventually got was nice but the front desk service SUCKS! Also, be aware of the AC it FREEZES you. Check out was nothing special also, I expected a "come back again" or "Hope you enjoyed your visit" but got nothing. As I was loading my 3 year old in the van she yelled "I gotta go to the bathroom" So I went back in and asked if I can take her back to the room to use the potty and they wouldn't even let me do that. We had to stop at a resturant. Even though the hotel was nice the sevice sucks and we won't be attending this hotel again..

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad........Sufficent”
Reviews.Author: ciccior94
Reviews.Content: My wife, 3 month daughter and I along with friends just returned from a long weekend at the Crystal Beach. I will start off by saying I was very unsure about staying at a small hotel with mixed reviews on Trip Advisor. However, the hotel was adequate....it did the job. Their is nothing special about the Crystal Beach. Yet it was for the most part clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and check in was easy. The only sign of uncleanliness in the room was smudges on the mirror. Pay extra and get the Ocean View b/c the efficency rooms truly have no view from the balcony. The beds wre ok.....but the air conditioning needs to be updated. It either freezes the room when on or the room gets way too hot. The way to get around it is too keep it on during the day....freeze the room and then shut it off when you get back after dinner and you will be ok for the night. The pool sits on the boardwalk which is very nice and the hotel is 10 feet from the beach. It is at the quieter end of the boardwalk which was very nice. The bottom line is that your not getting a 5 star resort...if u want that stay at the Hilton...but if u want a clean, adequate, reasonably priced hotel on the beach then the Crystal Beach Hotel is for you. Frank NY

Reviews.Title: “Not clean by any means!”
Reviews.Author: gkb1722
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for the Crystal Beach Hotel. The reviews seemed okay on Tripadvisor and I went in expecting much more. My high hopes quickly deminished. Upon check in the lobby of the hotel was nice enough and the staff while not overally friendly was fine. The problems began when we got to our room. The bathroom looked like it had never been cleaned. The bathtub was streaky and there were quite a few hairs in it. The sink handle was streaky as well and there were some mysterious spots on the floor and wall. The floor was even sticky! Also, we had reserved 2 queen beds. Well these weren't queen beds I was used to. They were tiny and hard as a rock. My husband and I had to sleep in seperate beds because these were so small. When I asked the staff they told me that they were indeed queen beds. Well my queen bed at home could have eaten these tiny things for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: kefer
Reviews.Content: This was my families second stay---- we took my daughter for her fourth birthday..... all employees were very pleasant would stay here again planning a trip for next summer and am looking to book again with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: trishshy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend in September and we will definitely go back this summer! The room was very clean and spacious and a great location. The price was a little high but I really liked it here so I think this will be our new hotel for Ocean City! The front desk staff was helpful and very friendly also. I would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel”
Reviews.Author: bonnieww
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a 2 night stay at Crystal Beach. I was a little nervous as we had never stayed here before. The motel turned out to be great. For what we pd it was wonderful. Very large side ocean view room which had two beds, sofa bed, & small kitchen area. Everything was clean & in very good condition. It was nice to have a parking garage too. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of plusses!”
Reviews.Author: mrsmarine
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in October and this place suited us well! Requested a high floor, oceanfront, nonsmoking, 2 beds and got it all....location was great,,,,ocean seemed so close you felt like you could feel the spray! Maid service was good---parking garage was a real bonus. Balcony was awesome even though it is not very private. We were fortunate our neighbors were quiet and friendly. Most importantly, the price was right! Would definitely stay here again in the off-season only as that's the only time we visit OC, MD.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Cyd'sTips
Reviews.Content: After searching up and down the boardwalk for a decent place to stay at reasonable rates, we were lucky enough to finally find the Crystal Beach Hotel. It's on the boardwalk at 25th street, a great location. The room was spacious and comfortable with a fridge, microwave and toaster. Every area was clean as a whistle. The pool is on the ocean side which is really nice. There's covered parking which is impossible to find on the boardwalk. The price was more than we wanted to pay, but the value compared to other properties we looked at, was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay there”
Reviews.Author: debbielang
Reviews.Content: Yes this is Debbie and Mark Langenfelder,we stayed there with our 2 kids for 7 days and had a wonderful time.The maid service was very good,and whenever we needed help the front desk was always very helpful.We hope to move to ocean city someday. Thank you Mrs.Debbie Langenfelder

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: BEACHGUY500
Reviews.Content: We visited the Crystal Beach Hotel for 5 days in July. Service was excellent....rooms were clean and the staff very friendly. Very convenient location...private parking garage that connects to the hotel 3rd floor. Located at the non-crowded end of the Boardwalk so it was quiet and the beach area was huge. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Crystal Beach a solid choice for Ocean City, however..........”
Reviews.Author: FairtoEveryone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crystal Beach for a 3 nights over the last weekend in August. As hotels in O.C. go, you could do much much worse than this hotel. I originally booked a side Ocean view room via the hotel's website for $189 a night at the beginning of August based on the many positive reviews I had read on tripadvisor. This was the only type of room and price the website showed as being available for my trip dates. The hotel has 79 rooms. I continued to check the website a couple times a week for other availability and prices. There were none. Then when I rechecked the website only one week before I was to arrive there were all these rooms which suddenly had become available, including Ocean Front , which had not ever been on the site for my trip dates during several previous weeks. It was as if a large group that had booked many rooms had just cancelled all of their reservations. I found all this sudden new availability to be very strange. I called and one of the owners upgraded me to Oceanfront for a rate of $229 a night. The very next day a very negative review appeared on tripadvisor for this hotel and, along with all this sudden room availability, I started getting very nervous. I am allergic to mold, and I decided to handle this by calling the Hotel and I read the review directly to one of the owners. She told me I was outside the 72 hour cancellation policy and that I could still cancell without penalty. She also told me if when I arrived and looked at the assigned room and did not like it I would not be held to the reservation. I do not know if this was really true, but I think reading the review to her made an impact. When I arrived at the hotel I was assigned to an Ocean Front room on the top (5th) floor which is non-smoking. The Ocean Front rooms do not have a sleeper sofa along with the 2 double beds like the side rooms; just the double beds. They are a bit smaller than the side rooms too but for two to four people it was fine and had plenty of room. The front view of the Boardwalk and the ocean was very nice and the balcony was large. The balconies are all the same size regardless of room location and can easily seat 3 or 4 people. Although you have an individual balcony, they really are not private if the people next to you are out on their balconies. For the most part, the people in the rooms next to me were not out on their balconies when I was, but if they had been I would have not enjoyed this balcony design as much as some other hotels from a privacy standpoint. On the other hand, because it is open, you have a very wide view up and down the O.C. boardwalk ocean around 25th street. That was nice. I agree with some of the other comments here saying the rooms are rather plain, but they certainly are not tired and run down looking in any way. I would describe them as being a step down from a new Hampton Inn. However, no Hampton Inn I know of has a view like this. There was no mold of any kind in my room or anywhere else where I could see at the hotel. While the public areas of the hotel are very clean, i would give the cleaning service in my room a B+. It was good but not great. Also, the beds are on the hard side, and not that comfortable. They were acceptable, but I think this hotel could do better. The lighting in the room is just too dim at night, and I found myself wishing I had brought a pack of 100 watt light bulbs with me. That would have been very helpful in the evening, and the lamps can accomodate that wattage. I suggest you do that if you stay there. The kitchen area was adequate with a good sized small refrigerator, microwave, and storage space. There was no stove, dishwasher or utensils. It is true there really is no lobby to this hotel. The front desk and check in area is the size of one the rooms if that. There were Security Cameras on every floor and you could see the view the cameras had behind the staff at the front desk. There are vending machines near the check in but no place to sit down. There is nothing of a lobby here like, for example, the Stoweaway Grand on 21st Street. The pool is in front of the hotel next to the Boardwalk. It is kind of on the small size but with plenty of lounge furniture to lay out in the sun. The area around the pool has plenty of room and did not seem too crowded at all. The pool was very clean and I saw hotel staff cleaning it every morning before it was opened for the day. That is a plus. There were problems with noise in the middle of the night on the Boardwalk even though this hotel is supposedly at the "quiet " end of the Bordwalk. Two of the three nights I was there the same group of 4 to 6 young adults ( not staying at the Hotel ) congregated at one of the benches on the Boardwalk and got very noisy around 1:00 to 2am. Yes, they were drinking. O. C. has a noise ordinance curfew in effect, and I did call the police the first night. I saw the police car drive up to the group the first night but they did not break up the partiers and the noise continued. I went to the front desk and Mike, the staff on duty checked out the situation and called the police on behalf of the Hotel. This time the police broke up the group. The second night it happened again I just went to the front desk right away and Mike again called the police immediately. There was no more middle of the night noise problems after that. I appreciated the Hotel's prompt attention to drunks on the Boardwalk disturbing their guests. The adjacent parking garage was very convenient and always had plenty of room for everyone. There was never any time wasted with the annoyance of trying to find a place to park. It is important to share that in talking with several other guests in the hallways and elevators, no one was disappointed in this hotel as an Ocean City property. People commented on its cleanliness, and one couple said they had checked out of a very dumpy motel nearby and that the Crystal Beach was the Plaza in comparison. Also, the elevators are modern and there is never a wait. Last summer I stayed at the Dunes Manor Hotel and the very slow elevators there were totally and completely unacceptable. Such a waste of time. The first evening of my stay when I was in the hall near the front desk I overheard a conversation between one of the owners and some potential walk in guests who wanted to stay for only 2 nights. It was a pleasure to hear the various room rates quoted to these persons were all HIGHER than what I was paying for an Ocean Front room with an advanced 3 night reservation. ( I do not like it when walk ins get a better deal than people with advanced reservations who trust the hotel to give them the best available price. ) They decided to leave and look elsewhere and the rates were not dropped to get them to stay. In closing, I will say that the hotel has responsible staff and owners who run things efficiently and professionally. There is no doubt about that. However, I have to say when I checked out I got the definate feeling from the owners that they could have cared less if I ever came back. As I checked out I thanked one of them who acted surprised someone would thank her and said bruscly "you are welcome". When I stood to the side of the front desk waiting to thank the other owner who was on the phone, I got the feeling i was annoying the first owner I had just thanked. When I thanked the second owner after she finished her phone call the first one said to me "I already said you are welcome." I found that comment to be strange. They aren't the most friendly people. As to whether or not I would return, the jury is out on that one. If owners of a hotel act like they don't care if you stay there again or not in the future, should you?

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jrh179
Reviews.Content: We checked out of the Seabonay 30 minutes after we got there and found this place! It was GREAT! The rooms have 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa and are in very good shape. They seem brand new. Our only problem was a broken alarm clark. Each room has a private balcony, but there's really no difference between Ocean View and Side View. Both have great views of the ocean. Of course they have Ocean Front rooms available too. It's at a great location at 25th Street, still on the boardwalk, but not too loud like some of the lower streets can be at night. Also Quizno's Subs right across the street. I would highly recommend staying at Crystal Beach! We loved it and can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beware allergy mold sufferers”
Reviews.Author: happy1234
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at the Crystal Beach Hotel. When we went in my daughter wanted to leave already, there was no lobby just a very small front desk and the front desk girls aren't so friendly.They don't have an automatic door so you have to try to hold the door open to get the luggage cart in while one of the boy hotel workers watch & laugh at you struggling to get everything in & not even offer to help hold the door open.. We had a ocean front room on the second floor. The view was nice but the room smelt horrible.There was black mold on the ceiling around the whole room. I had to go out & buy air freshner spray & spray the room at least 2-3 times a day. As soon as you get off the elevator the hallway has a musty & moldy smell, beware mold allergy sufferers. If you have back problems they will be worse in the morning, the beds are terrible. I told the front desk about people parking in the handicap parking spots that didn't have handicap tags & she asked if they had the crystal beach parking ticket in the window & I said yes but nothing was done about it. The same cars we're there for how many days. No I wouldn't go back. The place is hazardous to your health.

Reviews.Title: “5***** Hotel on the Boardwalk...Great Ocean View Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sherry_ann
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying in the Crystal Beach Hotel (we stayed June 20-23, 2006). This is a TERRIFIC hotel. We had 2 Adults and 3 children staying in our room. Our room was on the second floor and was Ocean View and had 2 Queen beds and a pull out sofa. The room was very clean and everything was in working order. The view was Great! We had a large view of the Ocean by just stepping out on to our balcony. The parking garage next door was also a plus. The pool was very clean and my kids loved swimming in it. There is also a shower in the pool area to rinse yourself off after coming back from the beach (There is beach access directly across the board walk in front of the hotel). There is a free ice machine and vending machine on the first floor and when we requested extra pillows, blankets, and towels they were quickly brought to our room. The maids cleaned our room every day and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I will definately stay in this hotel again! Also there is a Sunsations store just a short walk behind the hotel that has souveniers a lot cheaper than things on the Board Walk. The restaurant Jonah and the Whale is also a very short walk away and it has an EXCELLENT buffet that includes seafood, turkey, ham, tacos, potatoes, dessert , fruit , soup, and ice cream. Ther is something for everyone at this restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a last minute weekend getaway with my family at the Crystal Beach Hotel. We were very pleased with our choice of hotel. The room was very nice, clean, and roomy. Its a great place for a weekend away. We liked it so much we booked an extended weekend in July. We can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “not so great”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirl1111
Reviews.Content: Our family travels to Ocean city about 4-8 times per summer. We live about 3 hours away and this allows us a great get away. We have been to quite a few hotels there and this weekend tried a new place, The Crystal Beach Hotel. This is located on 25th street and the boardwalk. Because their website boasts a new hotel and new decorated rooms, I figured we were ok. We got in and had made a reservation for a Ocean view room, when we got into our room I could literally see into the next buildings bathroom. There was no view of the ocean. I went back down to the office and explained that I wanted an Ocean view room and the girl at the front desk told me that I need to pay more for the ocean side room and if I wanted a full view of the ocean, I needed to get the Ocean front room. We opted for the ocean front room, since it's off season, I got into one for 99.00 which wasn't bad. The room was pretty gross. The bed spreads were old and worn with cigarette burns in both that comforter and blankets. The room seemed clean but had that outdated, old feel to it. There was nothing to make you feel at home. It was very empty and plain. I really like a more plush, comfortable room and this just reminded me of a red roof inn or motel 6. You had to have certain switches on to make the TV and outlets work, I asked for more pillows and was handed them at the front desk with the pillow cases piled on top. They apparently dont bring things to your room there, as I balanced my 3 year old, a stroller and 4 pillows and pillow cases. We were in no way impressed and made the decision immediately that we wouldn't return. I will say that the view of the ocean was beautiful and I have included pics of both the room and the view. Think twice before you stay here! It wasn't all it was made out to be! Also, make sure if your staying here, your ready to walk as there aren't any shops or boardwalk restaurants for a long while.

Reviews.Title: “There are nicer, cleaner places...”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysreadyforLV
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long awaited visit to OC on 11/12/05. We considered staying at the Holiday Inn Express (125th St.), as had stayed there before and was nice, but decided on the ocean front room at Crystal Beach, after reading reviews on this site. Arrived at 1:30 p.m. and room was not ready. No problem. Walked the boardwalk until 3:00 when room was available. We were greeted by a baby mouse that had found it's way into the hotel lobby, much to the dismay of the desk clerk. We checked into a handicapped equipped room, (not requested), on the 2nd floor. The room looked as if it had not been thoroughly cleaned since summer began. In addition, the water from the shower head hit my 6'3" frame mid chest, as was handicapped equipped, and could not be raised any more than that. Although the hotel was quiet at night, and beds OK, be advised that you can do a lot better for your $ in OC. If it had been summertime, I would not have paid in season rates to stay at Crystal Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: DawnieLS
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The room was very clean, maid service was excellent. The price wasn't too bad compared to other O.C. hotels and included a jacuzzi in the room. There was always a parking space available in the garage right next to the hotel, and it included a little walk way straight across, right from the garage to the hotel floor we were on, no need to go through the lobby. We had a nice view of the beach from the balcony - even though it is just a side view. The staff was friendly and helpful, always smiling and greeting us when we went through the lobby. We have been back for Bike Week this past September, but we were unable to get a room at Crystal Beach - all booked up, we were disapointed. We are going again this weekend for the Cruise In Car show, and we called Crystal Beach first, but this hotel is booked up again, so we were forced to stay elsewhere. That must account for something - guess we have to call way in advance. We will definetly stay there again when we can get a room!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: flattop
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Crystal Beach Hotel during Sunfest.The hotel staff were very helpful with any questions we had and gave us recommendations for good food in the area.Our room was alot bigger then we were expecting-2 queen beds,large sofa small fridge,microwave,sink and coffee maker.The balcony was a nice size and even though we were just ocean view it was as good as ocean front.They have a large parking garage that easily fit my dually truck.The maid service was great and everything was very clean.The rooms are very quiet (can't hear neighbors) and no noise heard from the boardwalk.We will be returning again.
